did.abstract: Correspondence and collected periodicals of Dale Haviland, resident of Brighton, Michigan. Haviland edited a libertarian newsletter A is A and other titles.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Donated by Dale Haviland (donor no. 10994) in September 2013.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Dale Haviland papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: In the 1970s Brighton, Mich. resident Dale Haviland edited a libertarian newsletter A is A, and libertarian news and services catalog Mega Listings. He also compiled the 1972 Libertarian Periodicals Directory. Haviland and the A is A associate editors were engaged in correspondence with editors and compilers of other libertarian periodicals, as well as with the readers. Haviland published A is A Newsletter between 1971 and 1973, interrupted publication in 1974, and continued in 1975.

scopecontent.p: The Dale Haviland papers collection includes Haviland's correspondence and collected periodicals, pamphlets and catalogs used by Haviland to publish the A is A Newsletter, catalog of libertarian services and publications Mega Listings, and directories of libertarian press. The collection is organized into three series: Correspondence, Publications, and Collected Material.

The Correspondence series (0.75 linear feet) includes Haviland's exchanges with readers of the A is A Newsletter and other libertarian publications, who suggested titles for inclusion in Haviland's directory of libertarian press and articles to reprint. Also included here is Haviland's correspondence with authors, compilers, editors, and publishers of libertarian periodicals and catalogs. Haviland kept separate folders to hold his exchanges with some individuals, but the majority of his correspondence was organized in alphabetical order. Named files include correspondence with Mitchell Jones, editor of The New Individualist, Ralph Fucetola III, one of the editors of The Abolitionist, William Van Doren, The Diode editor and publisher; among others.

The Publications series (7.4 linear feet) is the heart of the collection. It is divided into three groups: Periodicals, Publications and Services Catalogs, and Pamphlets. The Periodicals is the largest of the three (7 linear feet) and includes the entire run of Haviland's A is A Newsletter. The majority of the periodicals found in the collection are U.S.-published, with a few exceptions, mostly published in the U.K. A great number of these periodicals are quite obscure and rare, in some cases hand- or typewritten on typewriters, with a few scattered issues in existence: Preform Inform, Vonulife, Atlantis Review; while others have been published for years: Imprimis, New Libertarian Notes, Southern Libertarian Messenger; among others. In some cases folders contain a small amount of correspondence related to publication. Some material has Haviland's comments.

did.unittitle: Central Michigan University Students for Objectivism Newsletter 1972-1973

odd.p: (published by Metropolitan Young Republican Club, place of publication not identified)

scopecontent.p: The Publications and Services group (0.15 linear feet) mostly contains libertarian book catalogs; also directories of periodicals and advertisements of audio-visual resources.
Among pamphlets (0.25 linear feet) researchers will find published speeches and essays on various subjects, as well as periodical series of pamphlets.

did.unittitle: Research Centre for Monetary and Financial Freedom 1976

scopecontent.p: The Collected Material series (0.75 linear feet) includes mailings, correspondence, flyers, announcements of libertarian political organizations and clubs, educational institutions, and student organizations. Material present in this series indicates Haviland's interest in independent education and campus activism. Also present here are subject files with collected material about Ayn Rand, Ron Paul, and Edith Efron, among others, as well as collected essays, unpublished papers and articles on subjects such as objectivism, free enterprise, currency, economics, education, etc.

odd.p: (see also Ayn Rand Society of Detroit)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Collections of Michigan libertarian newsletters from the holdings of the Bentley Historical Library: Libertarian Party of Lapeer/Genesee County newsletters, Libertarian Party of Oakland County newsletters, Libertarian Party of Wayne County newsletters, Libertarian Party of West Michigan newsletters, Macomb County Libertarian Party newsletters, Metro-Detroit Libertarian newsletters.

Individual Michigan periodical titles: Full disclosure, 1997; The Grass Roots Journal, 1990-1991, also available at the University of Michigan Special Collections Library; The Michigan Libertarian, 1986-2006 and 1975-2011 (DVD); MWM Libertarian, 1997; The Truth, November-December 1996; Voice of Liberty, 1995-1996; and Washtenaw Libertarian, 1990-2007.
Also Responsible Enterprise Association Educational Foundation records, 1945-1972 (0.1 linear feet).
